sen.j: ポーツマス条約（ポーツマスじょうやく）は、日露戦争の講和条約。
sen.e: Treaty of Portsmouth refers to a peace treaty of the Russo-Japanese War.
Treaty of Portsmouth refers to a peace treaty of the Russo-Japanese War.
Treaty of Portsmouth refers to a peace treaty of the Russo-Japanese War.
It is also called the Russo-Japanese Peace Treaty.
It is also called the Russo-Japanese Peace Treaty.

sen.j: 1905年(明治38年)9月5日15時47分に、アメリカ合衆国大統領セオドア・ルーズベルトの斡旋によって、アメリカ合衆国ニューハンプシャー州ポーツマス (ニューハンプシャー州)近郊のメイン州にあるポーツマス海軍造船所において、日本全権小村寿太郎とロシア全権セルゲイ・ヴィッテの間で調印された。
sen.e: At 15:47 on September 5, 1905, at the Portsmouth navy dock yard in the state of Maine near Portsmouth, New Hampshire, U.S., the treaty was signed between Jutaro KOMURA, the Japanese plenipotentiary, and Sergei Witte, his Russian counterpart, mediated by the President of the United States of America, Theodore Roosevelt.

sen.j: また、条約内容を交渉した会議（同年8月10日－）のことを 日露講和会議、ポーツマス会議、ポーツマス講和会議と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The conference where the contents of the treaty were discussed (from August 10 of the same year) is called Portsmouth Peace Conference.
The conference where the contents of the treaty were discussed (from August 10 of the same year) is called Russo-Japanese Peace Conference, Portsmouth Conference or Portsmouth Peace Conference.

tit.cmt: 見出しなので各語の頭文字を大文字に修正しました。

sen.j: 日露戦争において終始優勢を保っていた日本は、これ以上の戦争継続が国力の面で限界であったことから、当時英仏列強に肩を並べるまでに成長し国際的権威を高めようとしていた米国に仲介を依頼し交渉を行った。
sen.e: Realizing that its national resources had reached their limit and, hence, it could not continue with the war any longer, Japan, which had been keeping the advantageous position all through the Russo-Japanese War, negotiated with the U.S.A., which was at that time eager to enhance its international status by growing comparable with the great world powers, the U.K. and France, for mediation between the countries.

Realizing that its national resources had reached the limit and, hence, it could not continue with the war any longer, Japan, which had been keeping the advantageous position all through the Russo-Japanese War, requested the U.S.A., which had at that time comparable power to the great world powers, the U.K. and France, and was eager to enhance its international status, to mediate the negotiation between them.
sen.cmt: "their limit"→文中では日本を指す"it"を使っているので、ここでも"its"または"the"が良いと思います。訳文だと「2国間の調停に向けてアメリカと交渉をした」で、少し分かりにくいように思います。交渉をした相手はアメリカではなくロシアなので、「（ロシアとの）交渉の仲介をするようアメリカに依頼した」と修正しました。「当時英仏列強に」→匹敵するほど成長することによって国際的権威を高めようとした、ではなく、既に匹敵するほどに成長しており、その上で国際的権威を高めようとしていた、だと思います。
sen.e: Realizing that its national resources had reached the limit and, hence, it could not continue with the war any longer, Japan, which had been keeping the advantageous position all through the Russo-Japanese War, requested the U.S.A., which had at that time comparable power to the great world powers, the U.K. and France, and was eager to enhance its international status, to mediate the negotiation between them.

sen.j: 当初ロシアは強硬姿勢を貫き下記のような主張を行っていたため、交渉は暗礁に乗り上げていた。
sen.e: Russia initially took a vigorous attitude, insisting the following opinions, it hindered the negotiation process.

sen.e: Russia initially took a vigorous attitude, insisting the following opinions, and it hindered the negotiation process.
sen.cmt: 接続詞のandを挿入しました。
sen.e: Russia initially took a vigorous attitude, insisting the following opinions, and it hindered the negotiation process.

sen.j: 「たかだか小さな戦闘において敗れただけであり、ロシアは負けてはいない。」
sen.e: "Russia only lost in some minor battles but as a whole has not been defeated."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

"We still kept fighting."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "We will still keep fighting."
"We will still keep fighting."

sen.j: しかし、これ以上の戦争の継続は不可能である日本が譲歩し、この調停を成功させたい米国がロシアを説得するという形で事態を収拾し、戦争賠償金には一切応じないという最低条件で交渉は締結した。
sen.e: However, the process finally saw progress when Japan, which could not carry on with the war any more, made a concession and the U.S.A., which was keen to conclude the negotiation successfully, persuaded Russia into settlement by the minimum requirements of not answering a war reparation at all.

sen.j: 日本が困難な外交的取引を通じて辛うじて勝利を勝ち取った。
sen.e: Japan gained the victory barely through difficult diplomatic dealings.
Japan gained the victory barely through difficult diplomatic dealings.

sen.j: この条約において、日本は、満州南部の鉄道及び領地の租借権、大韓帝国に対する排他的指導権などを獲得したものの、戦争中に軍事費として投じてきた国家予算の約4倍にあたる20億円を埋め合わせるはずの戦争賠償金は取得することができなかった。
sen.e: Although it acquired the railway and lease for the territory in South Manchuria and exclusive authority over the Korean Empire, Japan failed to obtain the war reparation it had counted on to cover its war-time military expenditures of 2 billion yen, equivalent of four times its national budget.

sen.j: そのため、戦時中に増税による耐乏生活を強いられてきた日本国民が日比谷焼打事件などの暴動を起こした。
sen.e: The failure led to riots, such as Hibiya Incendiary Incident, by some Japanese nationals who had endured severe suppression and poverty due to increasing taxes during the war time.

sen.j: なおセオドア・ルーズベルトはこの条約仲介の功が評価されて、1906年(明治39年)にノーベル平和賞を受賞している。
sen.e: In addition, as for Theodore Roosevelt, success of this treaty brokerage was evaluated and won Nobel Peace prize in 1906.
In addition, Theodore Roosevelt won Nobel Peace Prize in 1906 for his successful mediation of the treaty.
sen.cmt: "won Novel Peace Prize"の主語をRooseveltに修正。"brokerage"は一般にビジネスとしての「仲介業」を意味するので、"mediation"の方が良いと思います。（http://www.thefreedictionary.com/brokerage）
sen.e: In addition, Theodore Roosevelt won Nobel Peace Prize in 1906 for his successful mediation of the treaty.

sen.j: 日本の朝鮮に於ける優越権を認める
sen.e: Japan was accepted the right of predominance in North Korea.
Japan shall be accepted to have the right of predominance in the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: 「朝鮮」→ここでは北朝鮮のことではなく、朝鮮半島のこと。当時は大韓帝国（李氏朝鮮）でした。条約の内容の説明なので、過去形より「～するものとする」"shall"を使った方が良いと思います。他、文法上の修正しました。
sen.e: Japan shall be accepted to have the right of predominance in the Korean Peninsula.

tit.j: 日露両国の軍隊は、鉄道警備隊を除いて満洲から撤退する
tit.e: The armies of Japan and Russia were withdrawn from Manchuria except for a railway garrison.
The armies of Japan and Russia shall be withdrawn from Manchuria except for a railway garrison.
tit.cmt: 条約の内容の説明なので、過去形より「～するものとする」"shall"を使った方が良いと思います。
tit.e: The armies of Japan and Russia shall be withdrawn from Manchuria except for a railway garrison.

tit.j: ロシアは樺太の北緯50度以南の領土を永久に日本へ譲渡する
tit.e: Russia permanently transferred a territory of the northern latitude 50 degrees southward of Sakhalin to Japan.
Russia shall permanently transfer the sounthern part of Sakhalin, from the northern latitude of 50 degrees, to Japan.
tit.cmt: 条約の内容の説明なので、過去形より「～するものとする」"shall"を使った方が良いと思います。「樺太の北緯50度以南の領土」→下記参照して表現を修正しました。（http://www.cleveland.com/world/index.ssf/2009/02/taro_aso_to_meet_dmitry_medved.html）

sen.e: Russia transferred the leases of the South Manchuria branch line between Lushun-Changchun of Chinese Eastern Railway and the coal mine of an attached place to Japan.

sen.e: Russia granted Japanese people the fishery right of the Enkai shu ((Russian) maritime provinces) coast.
